Ingredients.6: 2 (1 inch thick) slices day-old Italian bread

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking pan with aluminum foil.

Directions.2: Crack egg into a baking dish. Add white sugar, espresso, and vanilla extract. Whisk to combine. Place bread slices into the dish and toss in the mixture to saturate; let sit for 10 to 15 minutes to fully absorb.

Directions.3: Transfer bread slices to the prepared pan and drizzle any accumulated coffee mixture liquid over top.

Directions.4: Bake toast in the center of the preheated oven until custard is cooked and bread bounces back slightly when touched, 20 to 25 minutes. Transfer slices to a wire rack to cool to room temperature.

Directions.5: Meanwhile, pour wine into a saucepan. Add sugar and cook over medium heat until reduced to about 1 tablespoon. Remove from heat and let cool.

Directions.6: Place mascarpone cheese into a bowl and add cooled wine reduction and a very small pinch of salt. Stir with a spatula until combined. Chill before piping or spreading on cooled toast. Top with shaved chocolate.
